antiPatterns.name: Scattered Parasitic Functionality
antiPatterns.description: Multiple services are responsible for the same concern and some of these services are also responsible for orthogonal concerns.
antiPatterns.context: That a single concern is splitted among multiple services and that at least one service handles multiple orthogonal concerns violates important service-oriented principles. This means that these concerns infect services with another orthogonal concern, like a parasite.
antiPatterns.consequences: Modifiability, reusability, and testability may be reduced. Changing a scattered shared concern requires the changing and testing of several services. The shared concern also cannot be efficiently reused.
antiPatterns.cause: It may be a tempting shortcut to distribute a concern over several existing services.
antiPatterns.solution: Implement a monitoring connector to exchange the data or the status of the data.
antiPatterns.example: Service A has a SharedConcern. Service B and C also have this shared concern, but also an orthogonal concern ConcernB respectively ConcernC.
